title: PPP remains true voice of people: Nayyer Bukhari
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 26 (APP):Secretary General of Pakistan Peoples Party Parliamentarians (PPPP) Nayyer Hussain Bukhari on Thursday reaffirmed that the PPP remains the only true representative of the people.
He made these remarks while welcoming several former Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) leaders from Mianwali into the PPP during a joining ceremony held at the party’s Central Secretariat.
The leaders who joined included Shahid Abbasi, Maqbool Hussain, Malik Tajammul, Malik Muzaffar Niazi, Muhammad Sadeem, Muhammad Ramzan, and Qaiser Niazi.
Senior party leader of PPP including Senator Changez Jamali and Sakina Abdullah were also present at the ceremony.
Addressing the event, PPP Central Secretary Information Nadeem Afzal Chan highlighted the growing public support for the PPP’s vision and leadership.
“The steady flow of new members joining our ranks is a clear indication that people view the PPP as the only viable political force equipped with a clear agenda and practical solutions for Pakistan’s challenges,” he said.
Nadeem Chan reiterated the party’s historic role as a defender of workers’ rights and a voice for the underprivileged.
He said the PPP has always stood by laborers and is uniquely positioned to steer the country out of its current economic and social crises. “The future belongs to the PPP and to the people of Pakistan,” he declared.
He also lauded PPP Chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, calling him the face of Pakistan on the international stage and a source of hope for the youth, farmers, workers, and marginalized communities.
“Time and again, the PPP leadership has shown resilience in times of national crisis and played a vital role in guiding the country toward recovery,” he added.
Nadeem Chan urged the new members to actively promote the party’s message. “Carry forward the legacy of our martyrs. Take the voice of the PPP to every street, every neighborhood, and every household,” he said. “In these dark and challenging times, the PPP stands as the only beacon of hope for the nation.”
